name: ADCIRC
long_desc: ADCIRC, ADvanced CIRCulation, is a system of computer programs for solving time-dependent, free surface circulation and transport problems in two and three dimensions. These programs utilize the finite element method in space allowing the use of highly flexible and unstructured grids. All of the available programs are NetCDF capable to support the express creation and sharing of array-oriented hurricane data.
user_guide_desc: Read step-by-step instructions on getting started and a detailed breakdown of version differences in the User Guide.
